title: Stocks Climb as Investors Look to Washington
summary: Investors returned, and futures indicated a rise on Wall Street, a day after coronavirus fears and oil market disruptions caused the biggest sell-off in a decade.

summary: Officials from JPMorgan, Bank of America and other institutions will gather Wednesday at the White House to discuss help for businesses.

summary: European shares were higher after a broad drop in Asia, but futures markets signaled a tough day on Wall Street.

summary: A surge of risky borrowing by companies around the world leaves the global economy especially exposed to the potential costs of the outbreak.

summary: Stocks plunged anew as the outbreak was officially declared a pandemic and policies to address its impact proved lacking or ineffective.

summary: With global growth on the line, investors have been looking for world leaders to step in to keep the economic gears turning.

summary: The E.C.B. is encouraging banks to lend to small and medium-size businesses, but it decided not to cut a key interest rate.

summary: The S&P 500 rose more than 9 percent, making Friday its best day since 2008.

summary: Maryland, Virginia and Arizona issued statewide stay-at-home orders, and the F.D.A. granted emergency approval for the use of two malaria drugs to treat some coronavirus patients.

summary: The virus generates much the same fear and anxiety caused by terrorism, but it is brought by nature, not by humans. And it demands a different response: staying alone.

summary: In what was once one of South America’s poorest countries, a fraught transformation is underway, as oil riches bring optimism but also intensify ethnic tensions and environmental concerns.

summary: In Guayaquil, Ecuador’s biggest city, a surge in deaths has overwhelmed health care and burial services. Scenes of bodies on sidewalks and desperate families serve as a warning for the region.

summary: Indigenous people across the Americas are trying to defend their communities from the pandemic. But for many, isolation can quickly turn into deprivation.

summary: The country’s warring parties have proposed ways to end a devastating war, but yawning gaps remain and making progress will be tricky.

summary: We spent weeks following women inside the country’s health care system, which has been crippled by a broken economy overseen by an increasingly authoritarian government.
